Legal_Issue: Whether the citizenship judge erred in concluding the applicant did not meet the residency requirement under paragraph 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed 1,097 days of physical presence; provided inconsistent and insufficient evidence regarding activities and income in Canada
Court_Ruling: The appeal is allowed; case remanded for reconsideration by a different citizenship judge
Grounds_for_Claim: Erroneous application of both quantitative and qualitative tests simultaneously by the citizenship judge
Legal_Standard: Three years of residence in Canada within four years preceding application; assessed via physical presence or centrality of mode of existence
Assessment_Factor: Physical presence (1,097 days), income records, activity logs, credibility of evidence
Procedural_Issue: Simultaneous application of quantitative and qualitative residency tests leading to confusion
Credibility_Assessment: Applicant's evidence found inconsistent and insufficient
Evidence_Used: Applicantâ€™s statements, activity records, income documentation
Evidence_Assessed: Duration of stay, economic ties, personal connections to Canada
Relief_Sought: Grant of citizenship upon proper assessment of residency
Governing_Rule: Applicant must meet either the quantitative (physical presence) or qualitative (central mode of existence) test for residency
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Inconsistent and insufficient evidence regarding activities and income in Canada
Harm_Assessment: Unfair denial of citizenship due to legal error in residency assessment
Cause_Description: Applicant's citizenship application was denied due to alleged failure to meet residency requirements
Evidence_Handling: Insufficient documentation and inconsistencies undermined reliability
Evidence_Issues: Lack of corroborating documents for claimed residency period
Residency_Compliance: Not established due to evidentiary deficiencies and judicial error
Evidence_Assessment: Evidence deemed inadequate to prove required residency
Decision_Rationale: Error in law occurred by applying two tests simultaneously; case requires fresh assessment
Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistencies in applicant's evidence regarding presence and activities in Canada
Legal_Standard_Applied: Quantitative (days present) and qualitative (center of life) residency tests
